docs.lead_paragraph: International YEMEN'S GOVERNMENT AGREES TO CEASE-FIRE WITH REBELS
docs.snippet: International     YEMEN'S GOVERNMENT AGREES TO CEASE-FIRE WITH REBELS

docs.lead_paragraph: Anthem Blue Cross, the California health insurance company that was criticized by the Obama administration for raising its premiums, said Thursday that the increases of up to 39 percent were driven by rising health care costs.

headline.main: Administration Rejects Insurer's Defense of Rate Increases

docs.abstract: Even as Anthem defended its rate increases in California, an advocacy group claimed that top insurers together earned a record profit in 2009.
docs.snippet: Even as Anthem defended its rate increases in California, an advocacy group claimed that top insurers together earned a record profit in 2009.

docs.lead_paragraph: You may want to make sure you know where your health insurance card is.
docs.abstract: According to a new study, identity theft for the purpose of getting health care coverage may be on the rise.
docs.snippet: According to a new study, identity theft for the purpose of getting health care coverage may be on the rise.

docs.lead_paragraph: The "Voice for Choice" is feeling upbeat - at least, he is on the issue of selling health insurance across state lines.

headline.main: Wyden on Insurance: 'We Can Expand Competition'

docs.abstract: The senator from Oregon believes that Republicans and Democrats can find common ground on at least one issue: selling insurance across state lines.
docs.snippet: The senator from Oregon believes that Republicans and Democrats can find common ground on at least one issue: selling insurance across state lines.

docs.lead_paragraph: Medical care for immigrants who are in the country illegally has long been a sore subject. Emotions boiled over last fall when Representative Joe Wilson, Republican of South Carolina, shouted "You lie!" after President Obama, in a speech before Congress, denied that undocumented immigrants would receive free coverage under the Democrats' proposed health care legislation.
docs.abstract: Illegal immigrants cost the health care system about half as much per capita as United States-born citizens do, a new study finds.
docs.snippet: Illegal immigrants cost the health care system about half as much per capita as United States-born citizens do, a new study finds.

docs.lead_paragraph: A variety of consumer-focused articles appear daily in The New York Times and online in our blogs. Each weekday morning, we gather them together here so you can quickly scan the news that could hit your wallet.
docs.abstract: Toyota's rivals continue to offer trade-in incentives, a possible price revolt from e-book buyers and other consumer-focused items from Thursday's Times.
docs.snippet: Toyota's rivals continue to offer trade-in incentives, a possible price revolt from e-book buyers and other consumer-focused items from Thursday's Times.

docs.lead_paragraph: Doctors and hospitals will be able to check a patient’s private coverage and track claims through a single Web portal.

headline.seo: New Jersey Added to Trial to Cut Health Insurance Paperwork
headline.main: New Jersey Added to Trial to Cut Health Insurance Paperwork
headline.print_headline: New Jersey Is Added to Trial Program to Streamline Health Insurance Paperwork

docs.lead_paragraph: Virginia took another step on Tuesday toward becoming the first state to enact legislation to exempt its residents from a central feature of President Obama's health care plan: a requirement that everyone buy health insurance or pay a penalty.

headline.main: Virginia Advances Legislation Against Insurance Requirement

docs.abstract: Lawmakers in Virginia moved a step closer on Tuesday toward a state ban on any federal requirement that citizens purchase health insurance.
docs.snippet: Lawmakers in Virginia moved a step closer on Tuesday toward a state ban on any federal requirement that citizens purchase health insurance.

docs.lead_paragraph: The word of the week in Washington seems to be bipartisanship. President Obama hosted the first in a series of monthly meetings at the White House, and a health care summit for leaders in both parties is set to take place later this month.

headline.main: Politics A to Z: Bipartisanship, Blizzard Edition

docs.abstract: The meaning of bipartisanship gets a grilling, from health care to the midterm elections.
docs.snippet: The meaning of bipartisanship gets a grilling, from health care to the midterm elections.

byline.original: By ADAM NAGOURNEY AND JEFF ZELENY

docs.lead_paragraph: David Brooks: Gail, there I was watching the snow drift down on the Brooks estate in suburban Maryland last Saturday, when suddenly, after some spluttering and coughing, I was without power. Now I know how the Republicans feel.
docs.abstract: Is there any way to get beyond this legislative standstill in Congress?
docs.snippet: Is there any way to get beyond this legislative standstill in Congress?
